Issues.Title: ngOnDestroy never called when service is provided with an InjectionToken + useClass
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Description

When an injection token (and useClass) is used to provide a service, the `ngOnDestroy` method should be called when the component is disposed.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro-3qxrz4


## üî• Exception or Error

`ngOnDestroy` is  not called when an injection token is used for the provider - even though `useClass` (which is known at compile time) is used to actually instantiate the class.

While I understand that [factory providers have a similar issue and is harder to fix](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/14818) I don't understand why the following prevents `ngOnDestroy` being called.

    {
      provide: PAGE1SERVICE,
      useClass: Page1Service       // useClass
    }

This is very unexpected behavior and can lead to very subtle bugs. If this is never going to be fixed the [docs](https://angular.io/api/core/OnDestroy) should be updated to reflect the limitations of ngOnDestroy with respect to services + injection tokens..

## Possible workarounds

1)

    Page1Service,
    {
      provide: PAGE1SERVICE,
      useExisting: Page1Service       // useExisting
    }

2) Provide a custom management service by the component and implement some kind of custom lifecycle event.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
8.2.3

Repro is 6.1.9 (that's the forked sample)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ngOnDestroy never called when service is provided with an InjectionToken + useClass" (#32384)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Invalidate Reflector caches when program changes
Issues.Body:
This commit fixes a bug introduced in the recent refactoring whereby
caches become stale when the program changes.
This is because StaticReflector keeps its own caches that are not
clearable. The previous refactoring tried to reuse the same instance,
leading to out-of-sync program state.

Clearing out the *entire* cache is very inefficient. Instead, we could
just invalidate the symbols in the files that have changed. This
requires changes to the API of StaticReflector, but put this on hold
until the refactoring of language service for Ivy commences.

PR closes https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/32301

Issues.Title: IE 11 errors when optimization is set to true
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/cli ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 7 ### Description When our app is build with the CLI setting `"optimization": true`, it breaks on IE 11, despite having the correct setting for IE 11 in `browserslist` and the correct polyfills. The error message is variously in the form: `Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Object.create: argument is not an Object and is not null.`, and `ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Unable to get property 'enumerable' of undefined or null reference`. I can't tell exactly where the problem originates, but the immediate issue appeas to be somerwhere in polyfills. If i turn off `optimization`, it works fine, but of course, then optimization is off for ALL users. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I wish I could create a minimal repro of this. I haven't been able to, but if I get feedback that this is a serious issue (rather than, for example "`optimization` is known to be broken on IE"), I will to give it another try. You can see the problem in action now by loading [this page](https://boardgamegeek.com/image/100/stephensons-rocket) in IE. You can also see the same problem in older versions of Firefox (52) and Chrome(49); those aren't even nominally supported by Angular, but I mention them because the dev tools may be better. I do know that the problem doesn't occur on every page of our app--some of the more simple pages on our site, including [this one](https://boardgamegeek.com/join) seem to work OK, so the issue will not pop up on minimal site. ## üî• Exception or Error One error I've seen: 

Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Object.create: argument is not an Object and is not null.
And another: 

ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Unable to get property 'enumerable' of undefined or null reference
## üåç Your Environment Not sure the environment is relevant, since this is an issue in production, but I work and build the code on MacOS Mojave, but for production, the code is build on CentOS. **Angular Version:** 

@angular-devkit/architect         0.803.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.803.0
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.803.0
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.803.0
@angular-devkit/core              8.2.2
@angular-devkit/schematics        8.2.2
@angular/cdk                      8.1.3
@angular/cli                      8.3.0
@ngtools/webpack                  8.3.0
@schematics/angular               8.3.0
@schematics/update                0.803.0
rxjs                              6.5.2
typescript                        3.5.3
webpack                           4.39.2
**Anything else relevant?** Definitely broken only in IE 11 (of supported browsers), as well as Firefox 52 and Chrome 49 (of unsupported browsers). Thinking about it more, it may be a problem for all browsers which load ES5.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "IE 11 errors when optimization is set to true" (#32379)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): Use ts.CompletionEntry for completions
Issues.Body:
This is a prerequisite to fix a bug in template completions whereby
completion of the string `ti` for the variable `title` results in
`tititle`.

This is because the position where the completion is requested is used
to insert the completion text. This is incorrect. Instead, a
`replacementSpan` should be used to indicate the span of text that needs
to be replaced. Angular's own `Completion` interface is insufficient to
hold this information. Instead, we should just use ts.CompletionEntry.

Also added string enum for `CompletionKind`, which is similar to
ts.ScriptElementKind but contains more info about HTML entities.

Issues.Title: HTML5 template tag has a different behaviour
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Description When using a regular [template tag](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/template) inside of a component it doesn't generate a [DocumentFragment](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentFragment) (the content property is empty). From the MDN: > The HTMLTemplateElement has a content property, which is a read-only DocumentFragment containing the DOM subtree which the template represents. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-template-tag In the example you can see in the console the different behavior when running the same code inside of Angular and outside of it. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** From stackblitz package.json: 

"dependencies": {
    "@angular/common": "^8.0.0",
    "@angular/compiler": "^8.0.0",
    "@angular/core": "^8.0.0",
    "@angular/forms": "^8.0.0",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "^8.0.0",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "^8.0.0",
    "@angular/router": "^8.0.0",
    "core-js": "2",

    "zone.js": "^0.9.1"
}

Issues.Title: Consider supporting users in creating custom async pipes
Issues.Body: # üöÄ feature request Please consider supporting application developers in creating custom pipes with async behavior similar to the async pipe. ### Relevant Package I'm not sure what the relevant package would be. ### Description I've [asked a related question on Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/q/51481630/419956) and [answered it myself (with suboptimal workarounds)](https://stackoverflow.com/a/51495671/419956). As I see upvotes trickle in, without any better answers, I figured it would be good to open this feature requrest for it. Basically, I have a custom pipe that's used along these lines: ``` {{'some-key' | apiText | async}} ``` ### Describe the solution you'd like The thing is: we _always_ have to use it in tandem with `| async` with the above. What I'd _prefer_ to write is: ``` {{'some-key' | apiTextAsync}} ``` This reduces the amount of code in templates significantly, reducing the chance for mistakes and making my code more readable. The problem is that there's no good way to have an _custom_ pipe with the behavior from the `async` pipe. ### Describe alternatives you've considered The alternatives I've considered are [detailed precisely in my SO answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/51495671/419956), to reiterate the essentials: - **Composition**: create a `new AsyncPipe(injector.get(ChangeDetectorRef))` private variable in your pipe, and use it internally. - **Inheritance**: so make your pipe `extends AsyncPipe` but that leads to very complicated code - **Duplicate `async` source**: but then I have a _fork_ of the `async` pipe, with the obvious disadvantages So I personally fell back on just repeating `| async` everywhere in my templates. Which is also not nice.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Consider supporting users in creating custom async pipes" (#32368)

Issues.Title: AoTCompiler collects ng module even not being imported in my project
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/compiler ### Is this a regression? I'm afraid not ### Description 1. I need to use a 3rd angular library -- `moduleA` * it has components `compA`, `compB`, `compC` * `compB` is used inside `compA` * it exports all its components 2. for my probject, i need to use `compA`. 3. however, some behavior of compB is not what I desired. 4. Only thing I need is to inject a directive to `compB` to slight modify it's behavior. 5. I make a custom ng module `customModuleA` to declare those components again * put that directive in declaration also to allow recognition by compiler * drop the use of origin module `moduleA` * same way I did in the demo repo below. 6. JIT mode works well. AoT mode build with error. It turns out angular aot compiler blindly collects every things in typescript declaration. see https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/7.2.x/packages/compiler/src/aot/compiler.ts#L886. **Even for a ng module not being imported in the whole application.** ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/e-cloud/demo-repo-for-various-issues/tree/angular-aot-problem2 ## üî• Exception or Error ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5255354/63838339-bda9ea80-c9af-11e9-8741-a3545f60741a.png)

Issues.Title: ngcc error with pnpm: Node does not exist

# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/compiler-cli@8.2.2 (ivy) ### Is this a regression? Yes (relative to non-ivy) ### Description I'm using pnpm which creates a very strict node_modules hierarchy where packages cannot see any dependencies which are not declared in their manifest. Many Angular packages assume undeclared peerDependencies. When compiling with ivy, this manifests as an error like the one described in https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/29624. The problem is the error doesn't say what dependencies are missing. I am able to work around this by modifying DependencyResolver.prototype.sortEntryPointsByDependency to log the dependency graph which includes the invalid nodes. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a new angular project with pnpm without `shamefully-flatten` and attempt to `ng build` it. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [@bazel/bazel](https://bazel.build/) ([source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs)) | devDependencies | minor | [`0.28.1` -> `0.29.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/@bazel%2fbazel/0.28.1/0.29.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v0.29.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/0.29.0)

### BREAKING CHANGES

`ts_library` strict dependencies now apply to libraries from npm.
You can use `deps=["@​npm//:node_modules"]` to depend on all node_modules, but this has performance implications.
We suggest adding missing dependencies individually to the `deps` of the `ts_library`, following guidance from the compile errors.

### Changes

New `check_bazel_version_range` function to ensure your team uses the Bazel version you require

We automatically generate a named UMD bundle at `@npm//node_modules/package:package.umd.js` so that the concatjs bundler can work with third-party libraries.

`ts_library` now automatically gathers typings from npm packages in the `deps`.

`web_package`

-   Support the same root paths as `ts_devserver`, fix for [#​728](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/728)

`rollup_bundle`

-   now includes the json plugin
-   bugfix for downleveling

</details>

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/cli): migrate e2e tests to async/await
Issues.Body:
Protractor recently introduced a breaking change in version 6.0.0: no more custom control flow, everyone should use async/await instead.

Source: https://github.com/angular/protractor/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md
> Control flow is removed and you should use async await to run your tests.

This behaviour is already accessible in versions before 6.0.0 under the flag SELENIUM_PROMISE_MANAGER=false.

By setting this flag to false - which is the default in 6.0.0 - I hope to reduce the migration time of new users of Angular using the CLI and using Protractor for e2e.

I personnaly did the migration 2 years ago and I believe it is preferable to start directly in async/await mode. It makes the test easier to read and futurproof.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular/cli): migrate e2e tests to async/await" (#15472)

Issues.Title: ng serve, should serve a health check route like `GET /health_check`
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

For our stage/dev environment for an Angular app, we may just use `ng serve` to serve an application, at least in the short-run.

We need our EC2 load balancer to hit a health check route. Does the `ng serve` server have a good route for a health check?

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57681264/angular-7-8-respond-to-health-checks-on-the-dev-server?noredirect=1#comment101809228_57681264

I am looking for something like:

`GET /health_check`

and it responds with HTTP 200 OK

It's a webpack-dev-server, so maybe it's:

```
GET locahost:4200/webpack-dev-server/health_check
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng serve, should serve a health check route like `GET /health_check`" (#15463)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/cli): add support for custom npmrc path
Issues.Body:
According to [the npm config docs](https://docs.npmjs.com/misc/config#npmrc-files), a user can specify the path to their
`npmrc` file using the environment variable `NPM_CONFIG_USERCONFIG`.

I ran into this issue on my system because I have my `npmrc` file in a custom location. I noticed it when running `ng
update @angular/cli` because there were 404 errors on a few internal packages, which indicated that my `npmrc` was not
being honored.

I'm not sure if this fix is sufficient, but wanted to at least start a conversation about the issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular/cli): add support for custom npmrc path" (#15459)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): exclude TSX test files from test coverage
Issues.Body:
I missed this in #15381.

Workaround is to use `codeCoverageExclude` in `angular.json`:
```json
"codeCoverageExclude": ["**/*.spec.tsx"],
```

Issues.Title: support lazy loading for ng components by default.
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
Angular Components
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/CLI


### Description
It would be better if Angular provides lazy loading of angular components by default.

Reason:
As the total number of components/modules to load in the main angular app increases,
it definitely produces a performance penalty, making the application slower and sluggish.
This happens even for smaller ng apps, when used in conjunction with angular material.  
 
### Describe the solution you'd like
Using the following command:

ng generate component [component-name] 
(or)
ng g c  [component-name]

1. should produce a "module" and the "component" for the given [component-name].
2. The "module" should have pre-configured reference to the "component",  to facilitate lazy loading the component.
3. a corresponding route mapping in the "app routing module" should be generated with a path referring to the  [component-name].

Note: Hope this should provide some productivity improvement, when it comes to coding/dev work. 
* 
### Describe alternatives you've considered
None.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "support lazy loading for ng components by default." (#15442)

Issues.Title: build: bazel typescript targets should use tsickle for decorator processing
Issues.Body:
We want to enable tsickle for decorator processing. This was one of the
blockers for using the bazel packages in releases as unprocessed decorators
will end up referencing DOM specific globals (e.g. `HTMLElement`).

These references would then break server-side rendering for non CLI
projects. Read more about this https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/30586
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: bazel typescript targets should use tsickle for decorator processing" (#16906)

Issues.Title: fix(drag-drop): connected drop zones not working inside shadow root
Issues.Body:
Fixes not being able to drop into a connected drop list when using `ShadowDom` view encapsulation. The issue comes from the fact that we use `elementFromPoint` to figure out whether the user's pointer is over a drop list. When the element is inside a shadow root, calling `elementFromPoint` on the `document` will return the shadow root.

These changes fix the issue by calling `elementFromPoint` from the shadow root instead.

Fixes #16898.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(drag-drop): connected drop zones not working inside shadow root" (#16899)

Issues.Title: fix(icon): not copying attributes from symbol nodes
Issues.Body:
Currently we have some special handling for the cases where an icon resolves to a `symbol` node, because cloning it directly won't display anything. Our workaround is set up by creating a blank SVG and copying over all of the children of the `symbol` into it, however this doesn't account for any attributes on the `symbol` (e.g. its `viewBox`).

These changes also copy over all the attributes.

Fixes #16892.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(icon): not copying attributes from symbol nodes" (#16896)

Issues.Title: Angular DropList with cdkDropListConnectedTo not working in ShadowDom
Issues.Body:
Dragging items from one list to another list where both list are in the same shadow roots does not work.

## Reproduction

Steps to re-create:
* Use the example from https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview#transferring-items-between-lists
* Go to https://stackblitz.com/angular/mgodlvpbbjd?file=app%2Fcdk-drag-drop-connected-sorting-example.ts
* Change the CdkDragDropConnectedSortingExample to use ViewEncapsulation.ShadowDom
* See the issue: item from one list cannot be dragged to another list.

This is because of the condition check "elementFromPoint === nativeElement || nativeElement.contains(elementFromPoint)" in the method _canReceive : https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drop-list-ref.ts#L834
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular DropList with cdkDropListConnectedTo not working in ShadowDom" (#16898)

Issues.Title: MatSpinner making scroll bars bounce
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ohvkwv

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a spinner
2. Place in an element with overflow: auto
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
See the mat spinner, spinning, inside a div.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
The spinner spins, but the div has scroll bars bouncing around.

#### Fix (?)
Playing with the CSS, it seems like this can be fixed once and for all (I keep hitting this all the time) if:
- The spinning animation is moved from the host to the actual svg
- The host is given the style overflow: hidden

#### Environment

- Angular: "8.0.0"
- CDK/Material: "8.1.4"
- Browser(s): Version 76.0.3809.100 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Debian GNU/Linux rodete

Issues.Title: matIcon: Use the symbol viewBox by default
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

When I register an SVG icon set containing symbols I would like that matIcons utilize the viewBox from the symbol. While [this PR](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/16320) allows us to set a viewBox value when registering the set, it will use the same value for all the symbols. 

#### Use Case

This way we can have a resizable icon without any additional setting.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "matIcon: Use the symbol viewBox by default" (#16892)

Issues.Title: MatSelectionList accent color not correctly applied when inside tabs
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-u8tctx
 
#### Expected Behavior

Selection list checkboxes should default to `accent` regardless of their parent.

#### Actual Behavior

Selection list checkboxes get stuck on `primary` even when `accent` is explicitly specified, when inside components that _do_ apply a theme class, such as tabs.


This is because `MatSelectionList` doesn't apply a specific theme when `accent` is set: https://github.com/angular/components/blob/e6afdbb9db80b6b5e8175a2873e60176cbcaab8f/src/material/list/selection-list.ts#L105

However, this fails when the selection list is inside tabs as those tabs _do_ have a `mat-primary` theme set on them which overrides this default behaviour.

Here is the theme logic inside `pseudo-checkbox`:

https://github.com/angular/components/blob/9eeb4b5aa0473c0815a73bfe3c2ed6164d86a3b3/src/material/core/selection/pseudo-checkbox/_pseudo-checkbox-theme.scss#L35


This could be fixed by explicitly setting the default accent class on the selection list when none is specified (or accent is explicitly specified).

#### Environment

Latest StackBlitz
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MatSelectionList accent color not correctly applied when inside tabs" (#16891)

Issues.Title: Request - Show days of overlapping months, remove redundant information
Issues.Body:
### Expected behavior

Display dates of overlapping months and therefore remove the second month-name label.


### Current behavior

`mat-calendar` does not show dates of overlapping month and displays the current months' name two times.

### Version 

Angular 7

----

I am using `mat-calendar` in my application, with some custom style it looks like this:

![Screenshot from 2019-08-27 14-47-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1429426/63772541-8f59db80-c8d9-11e9-8930-14239cd60fe3.png)

Now, the thing is that it would be more usefull if the missing days for the overlapping months are also displayed. Similar to the Google Calendar:

![Screenshot from 2019-08-27 14-49-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1429426/63772651-d47e0d80-c8d9-11e9-8061-dca6990cb2be.png)

Also displaying the date name where it is now is "wrong" for two reasons:

- The month name is displayed in a clearly labelled matrix and is therefore simply in the wrong place here
- It's redundant as the months' name is already displayed in the title
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Request - Show days of overlapping months, remove redundant information" (#16889)

Issues.Title: build: workaround for dev-app livereloading with ibazel
Issues.Body:
Adds a workaround that makes livereloading work most of the time. It won't
work if the default port for the ibazel livereloading script has changed. This
can happen if the port is already used/reserved or if the default port changes
in the `livereload-server` implementation.

Ideally the livereloading script would be served from a canonical location
that always works (regardless of the port). A proposal for this has been
submitted within: https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_typescript/pull/468
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: workaround for dev-app livereloading with ibazel" (#16882)

Issues.Title: Mat-Grid-List: gutterSize support for fxLayout
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
maybe it is related to (https://github.com/angular/components/issues/4211 or https://github.com/angular/material/issues/10654).

I would appreciate it if it would be possible to use clean fxLayout responsive attributes in the Mat-Grid-List `gutterSize`.

`<mat-grid-list cols="3" rowHeight="1:1" gutterSize="50px" gutterSize.lt-md="20px">`


#### Use Case

This would make it possible to seamlessly reduce the distances between individual tiles on mobile devices.

#### Status quo
Currently there is the possibility to use the `MediaObserver` in the TS to store the current state in a variable and to access it by expression. But this is cumbersome and doesn't feel right.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat-Grid-List: gutterSize support for fxLayout" (#16881)
